meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a node
meanings.sent1: The enodal connection between the two computers was strong.
meanings.sent2: The enodal network allowed for efficient communication.
meanings.sent3: The enodal server was always the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: Her enodal personality made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The enodal relationship between the two friends was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: to form a node or nodes
meanings.sent1: She enodals the network to ensure smooth data flow.
meanings.sent2: The plants enodal to create a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: He enodals the team together for a successful project.
meanings.sent4: The river enodals at the meeting point of two streams.
meanings.sent5: The students enodal to share ideas and collaborate on the assignment.

meanings.definition: a point at which lines or pathways intersect
meanings.sent1: The enodal of the roads caused traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: The enodal of the train tracks was a busy junction.
meanings.sent3: The enodal in the map marked the treasure's location.
meanings.sent4: At the enodal of the rivers, fishermen gathered to catch fish.
meanings.sent5: The enodal in the maze was the key to finding the exit.
